alert.note: Alert for Pembina (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 10:02PM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Richland and Wilkin Counties. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Kittson and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North near Hickson affecting Cass County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Grand Forks, Walsh, Polk and Marshall Counties. Red River of the North at Halstad affecting Traill and Norman Counties. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Grand Forks and Polk Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Clay and Cass Counties. Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Kittson, Walsh, Pembina and Marshall Counties. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at Pembina. * WHEN...From Thursday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, City dike patrol begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 37.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening and continue rising to 47.6 feet Wednesday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 39.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
